circumstances: During the takeoff roll at Tulsa Airport on an runway covered by slush, the pilot started the rotation prematurely. The airplane climbed a few feet then stalled and crashed back onto the runway. Out of control, it veered off runway and came to rest. Both occupants were slightly injured and the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
Engine malfunction during takeoff run and initial climb. The following factors were reported:
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- Premature liftoff,
- Failed to obtain flying speed, 
- Disregard of good operating practice, 
- Improper emergency procedures, 
- Ice/slush on runway, 
- Partial loss of power on one engine, 
- Engines check ok prior to takeoff, 
- No full power runup due to ice on runway, 
- Rotated below VNC, 
- Observers heard engine backfire.
